head.title: The Energy Plan: Points of Light, and Heat

hedline.hl1: The Energy Plan: Points of Light, and Heat

abstract.p: Stephen K Hiltner letter faults Pres Bush's energy plan (May 17 article) for encouraging greater consumption and paying only lip service to conservation; cartoon

block.p: President Bush's call in his energy plan for increased extraction of fossil fuels (front page, May 17) is characterized as a long-term solution. Yet by encouraging greater consumption, it increases energy demand while reducing the country's energy holdings available for future use.
The long-term effect is greater dependency on foreign sources.

President Bush's call in his energy plan for increased extraction of fossil fuels (front page, May 17) is characterized as a long-term solution. Yet by encouraging greater consumption, it increases energy demand while reducing the country's energy holdings available for future use.
The long-term effect is greater dependency on foreign sources.
Conservative lip service to energy conservation reveals an indifference not only to the environment but also to the trade deficit and national security. STEPHEN K. HILTNER Durham, N.C., May 17, 2001
